label: 3D Resource Type
rdfs_comment: Description of the media format but which is distinct from file format as implied by extension: controlled vocabulary

label: Color Boolean
rdfs_comment: Surface Quality: Indicates whether each vertex with a unique x,y,z coordinate or polygonal face also has an associated color specified. Values will be “True” / “False”
dcterms_description:
Use this term in combination with these other AC terms -- i.e., when: 
- ac:3DResourceType is point cloud or polygonal mesh
- and dc:format(s) is any of: pts, off, ply, obj, stl, glb, gltf, X3d, wrl
- and any ac:resourceCreationTechnique(s)

label: Face Count
rdfs_comment: Dimensions: Number of triangles or polygons with a unique set of three or more points as their vertices
dcterms_description:
Use this term in combination with these other AC terms -- i.e., when: 
- ac:3DResourceType is a polygnal mesh
- and dc:format(s) is any of: off, ply, obj, stl, glb, gltf, X3d, wrl
- and any ac:resourceCreationTechnique(s)

label: Normals Boolean
rdfs_comment: Surface Quality: Indicates whether each vertex or polygonal face also has an associated normal vector specified. Values will be “True” / “False”
dcterms_description:
Use this term in combination with these other AC terms -- i.e., when: 
- ac:3DResourceType is point cloud or polygonal mesh
- and dc:format(s) is any of: pts, off, ply, obj, stl, glb, gltf, X3d, wrl
- and any ac:resourceCreationTechnique(s)

label: Number of Images
rdfs_comment: Dimensions: The number of images or z-axis pixels that provide information on a 3D scene
dcterms_description:
Additional usage notes for “numberOfImages”: This term shall be used to specify the number of files or slices in a projection series (CT), reconstructed image series (CT, MRI), or that were collected in a photogrammetry session. In cases where volume raster data is represented as a single file (Nifti, NRRD, 3D tiff, dicom Multi-files) it should be used to give the number of Z axis pixels. Other possible uses include any case where each file in a collection represents a part or a view of a single or multiple focal objects that together can be used to understand the 3D nature of the focal object(s). For instance, raw data from laser scans and structured light scans often include a number of partial meshes that represent different parts of the scanned object which need to be processed through alignment and merging before rendering as a full 3D object.

Use this term in combination with these other AC terms -- i.e., when: 
- ac:3DResourceType is any of the following values: multi-file projection series, multi-file image slices series, single file image slice series, image collections
- and dc:format(s) is any of: "raw", dcm, tiff, bmp, png, jpeg, nifti, nrrd, "zip"
- and any ac:resourceCreationTechnique(s)

label: Pixel X Spacing
rdfs_comment: Resolution: The linear distance between each pixel in the X direction with units specified by associated Library of Congress Bibframe term, bf:Unit
dcterms_description:
Use this term in combination with these other AC terms -- i.e., when: 
- ac:3DResourceType is any of: multi-file projection series, multi-file image slice series, single file volume image
- and dc:format(s) is any of: "raw", dcm, tiff, bmp, png, jpeg, nifti, nrrd, "zip"
- and ac:resourceCreationTechnique is any of: CT, MRI, PET, Neutron, Synchotron, confocal microscopy, optical image stacking

label: Pixel Y Spacing
rdfs_comment: Resolution: The linear distance between each pixel in the Y direction with units specified by associated Library of Congress Bibframe term, bf:Unit
dcterms_description:
Use this term in combination with these other AC terms -- i.e., when: 
- ac:3DResourceType is any of: multi-file projection series, multi-file image slice series, single file volume image
- and dc:format(s) is any of: "raw", dcm, tiff, bmp, png, jpeg, nifti, nrrd, "zip"
- and ac:resourceCreationTechnique(s) is any of: CT, MRI, PET, Neutron, Synchotron, confocal microscopy, optical image stacking

label: Pixel Z Spacing
rdfs_comment: Resolution: The linear distance between each pixel in the Z direction with units specified by associated Library of Congress Bibframe term, bf:Unit
dcterms_description:
Use this term in combination with these other AC terms -- i.e., when: 
- ac:3DResourceType is any of: multi-file projection series, multi-file image slice series, single file volume image
- and dc:format(s) is any of: "raw", dcm, tiff, bmp, png, jpeg, nifti, nrrd, "zip"
- and ac:resourceCreationTechnique(s) is any of: CT, MRI, PET, Neutron, Synchotron, confocal microscopy, optical image stacking

label: Point Count
rdfs_comment: Dimensions: Number of vertices with unique 3D X, Y, Z coordinates
dcterms_description:
Use this term in combination with these other AC terms -- i.e., when: 
- ac:3DResourceType is point cloud or polygonal mesh
- and dc:format(s) is any of: pts, off, ply, obj, stl, glb, gltf, X3d, wrl
- and any ac:resourceCreationTechnique(s)

label: Resource Creation Technique
rdfs_comment:
Field gives the modality of the 3D resource creation event according to standard terms being developed by this group: controlled vocabulary

- existing term's definition http://rs.tdwg.org/ac/terms/resourceCreationTechnique.htm

label: Texture Map Type
rdfs_comment: Surface Quality: Controlled vocabulary for texture map type associated with a point cloud or polygonal mesh resource
dcterms_description:
Repeatable because some meshes or point clouds have multiple.

Use this term in combination with these other AC terms -- i.e., when: 
- ac:3DResourceType is point cloud or polygonal mesh
- and dc:format(s) is any of: pts, off, ply, obj, stl, glb, gltf, X3d, wrl
- and any ac:resourceCreationTechnique(s)

label: UV Coordinates Boolean
rdfs_comment: Surface Quality: Indicates whether a mesh file has UV coordinates that map it to one or more materials or texture files. Values will be “True” / “False”
dcterms_description:
Use this term in combination with these other AC terms -- i.e., when: 
- ac:3DResourceType is point cloud or polygonal mesh
- and dc:format(s) is any of: pts, off, ply, obj, stl, glb, gltf, X3d, wrl
- and any ac:resourceCreationTechnique(s)
